results.name: Number of partitions of n with rank 1 (the rank of a partition is the largest part minus the number of parts).
comment: Column k=1 in the triangle A063995.
reference: George E. Andrews, The Theory of Partitions, Addison-Wesley, Reading, Mass., 1976.
formula: G.f. for the number of partitions of n with rank r is Sum((-1)^k*x^(r*k)*(x^((3*k^2+k)/2)-x^((3*k^2-k)/2)), k=1..infinity)/Product(1-x^k, k=1..infinity). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Dec 20 2004
maple: with(combinat): for n from 1 to 35 do P:=partition(n): c:=0: for j from 1 to nops(P) do if P[j][nops(P[j])]-nops(P[j])=1 then c:=c+1 else c:=c fi od: a[n]:=c: od: seq(a[n],n=1..35);
